metadata.title: CVE-2024-36893 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:typec: tcpm: Check for port partner validity before consuming ittypec_register_partner() does not guarantee partner registration to alwayssucceed. In the event of failure, port->partner is set to the error valueor NULL. Given that port->partner validity is not checked, this results inthe following crash: Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference atvirtual address xx pc : run_state_machine+0x1bc8/0x1c08 lr :run_state_machine+0x1b90/0x1c08 .. Call trace:run_state_machine+0x1bc8/0x1c08 tcpm_state_machine_work+0x94/0xe4kthread_worker_fn+0x118/0x328 kthread+0x1d0/0x23c ret_from_fork+0x10/0x20To prevent the crash, check for port->partner validity before derefencingit in all the call sites.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic-64k - 6.8.0-40.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1013-aws - 6.8.0-1013.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-azure - 6.8.0-1012.14
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency - 6.8.0-40.40.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-40.40.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle - 6.8.0-1010.10
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1009-raspi - 6.8.0-1009.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oem - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1009.16

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.1-1006-realtime - 6.8.1-1006.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
